definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

pinyin: Ying1 guo2 Huang2 jia1 Xue2 hui4

definition: Deutsches Institut für Normung e.V. (DIN)/German Institute for Standardization
pinyin: De2 guo2 Biao1 zhun3 hua4 Xue2 hui4
Zhong1 guo2 Di4 qiu2 Wu4 li3 Xue2 hui4
Zhong1 guo2 Niao3 lei4 Xue2 hui4
Mei3 guo2 Guo2 jia1 Biao1 zhun3 Xue2 hui4

definition: The Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET)
pinyin: Ying1 guo2 Gong1 cheng2 Ji4 shu4 Xue2 hui4

sentences.english: Learn how to handle setbacks. Life is made of ups, downs, and disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 學會如何處理挫折，生活由順利，挫折和失望構成。

sentences.english: I can think of the most romantic thing is to learn social dance.
sentences.chinese: 我能想到的最浪漫的事，就是學會跳交誼舞。

sentences.english: But once he learns, he'll never forget.
sentences.chinese: 但一旦他學會，就永遠忘不掉了。

sentences.english: The key to following your heart is to learn to deal with fear.
sentences.chinese: 要做到心隨所願，祕訣在於學會克服恐懼。

sentences.english: Learn how to discern and develop true friends.
sentences.chinese: 學會辨別真假，交些真正的朋友吧。

sentences.english: If children live with jealousy, they learn what envy is.
sentences.chinese: 在嫉妒中成長的孩子，學會鉤心鬥角。

sentences.english: I have learned to act quickly and take interest in learning.
sentences.chinese: 學會了迅於行和保持學習興趣。

sentences.english: Perishes , only blames opening which oneself has not put.
sentences.chinese: 沉淪，只怪，臫巳還沒能學會放旳開。

sentences.english: I'll let you put your own quotations around the word experts.
sentences.chinese: 我要讓你學會自己辨別誰是真專家誰是假的。

sentences.english: I learned to live when I thought it better to die …
sentences.chinese: 萬念懼灰的時候，我學會了生存。

sentences.english: Traditional Chinese Medicine Committee of Diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 中國中醫藥學會消渴病專業委員會。

sentences.english: Read about about the causes of diabetes and how to prevent it.
sentences.chinese: 讀一些關於糖尿病的誘因並學會如何做好預防措施。

sentences.english: To survive as individuals, we'll have to learn to temper our trust.
sentences.chinese: 作爲個體想要生存，我們就必須學會調和我們的信任。

sentences.english: Museums and the Smithsonian Institution buildings are on the north and south sides of the Mall.
sentences.chinese: 博物館和史密森氏學會大樓在廣場的北面和南面。

sentences.english: These things could change if you learn how to manage your violence.
sentences.chinese: 如果你學會控制自己的暴力行爲，這些都會改變的。

sentences.english: Learn to locate these stars, and you'll always be able to find Capricornus.
sentences.chinese: 學會去找到這些星星們，找摩羯座就會很容易上手。

definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to guide/to give directions/to direct/to coach/guidance/tuition/CL:個|个[ge4]
to join/to connect/to link up/to communicate
